schema.title: Response Fetch Aersurface Runs List List Aersurface All Get
Response Fetch Aerscreen Runs List List Aerscreen All Get
Response Fetch Aermod Runs List List Aermod All Get
Response Fetch Finished Runs List Any Finished Get
Response Fetch Failed Runs List Any Fail Get
Response Fetch In Progress Runs List Any In Progress Get
Response Fetch Run Messages Results Any Run  Run Id  Messages Get

deg_from_north_of_max_hor_dim.title: Deg From North Of Max Hor Dim

deg_from_north_of_stack_rel_to_center.title: Deg From North Of Stack Rel To Center

CenterLL.title: CenterLL
CenterLL.description: Location of meteorology tower in Lat/Long

CenterXY.title: CenterXY
CenterXY.description: Location of meteorology tower in UTM Easting/Northing

Daytable.title: Daytable
Daytable.description: O – N Option to print summaries for each averaging period for each day processed.

Evalfile.title: Evalfile
Evalfile.description: O – R Option to output file of normalized arc maxima from EVALCART receptors for model evaluation studies

Eventout.title: Eventout
Eventout.description: M – N Specifies the level of output information provided for EVENT Processing [EVENT Only]

Fileform.title: Fileform
Fileform.description: O – N Specify fixed or exponential format for output results files

FrequencySectors.title: FrequencySectors
FrequencySectors.description:
If VARYAP is entered, then AP flag must be
defined individually for each sector

LandUseType.title: LandUseType
LandUseType.description:
Land use type for surface characteristics. 
If 9, use output from AERSURFACE.
If 0, use user-enteed values
Else, use values looked up from AERMET tables

Maxdaily.title: Maxdaily
Maxdaily.description: O – R Option to output file of daily maximum 1-hour values for each day processed; only applicable for 1-hour NO2 and 1-hour SO2 NAAQS

Maxdcont.title: Maxdcont
Maxdcont.description: O – R Option to output contributions of each source group to ranked values averaged across years for a reference source group, paired in time and space; only applicable for 24-hour PM2.5 1-hour NO2 , and 1-hour SO2 NAAQS

Maxifile.title: Maxifile
Maxifile.description: O – R Option to list events exceeding a threshold value to file (if CO EVENTFIL option is used, these events are included in the input file generated for the EVENT model).

Maxtable.title: Maxtable
Maxtable.description: O – R Option to summarize the overall maximum values

MonthToSeasonAssignment.title: MonthToSeasonAssignment
MonthToSeasonAssignment.description: Can be modified if FREQ_SECT is ANNUAL or MONTHLY

Mxdybyyr.title: Mxdybyyr
Mxdybyyr.description: O – R Option to output file of daily maximum 1-hour values by year, for each year processed; only applicable for 1-hour NO2 and 1-hour SO2 NAAQS

Noheader.title: Noheader
Noheader.description: O – N Option to suppress file headers for output file options, e.g., POSTFILE, PLOTFILE, MAXDCONT, etc.

Plotfile.title: Plotfile
Plotfile.description: 1 O – R Option to write certain results to a storage file suitable for input to plotting routines

Postfile.title: Postfile
Postfile.description: 1 O – R Option to write results to a mass storage file for postprocessing.

Rankfile.title: Rankfile
Rankfile.description: O – R Option to output file of ranked values for Q-Q plots (must be used with the MAXTABLE keyword)

Rectable.title: Rectable
Rectable.description: O – R Option to specify value(s) by receptor for output

Seasonhr.title: Seasonhr
Seasonhr.description: O – R Option to output results by season and hour-of-day

Summfile.title: Summfile
Summfile.description: O – N Option to output summary of high ranked values to separate file

SurfaceRoughnessLengthWindSectors.title: SurfaceRoughnessLengthWindSectors
SurfaceRoughnessLengthWindSectors.description:
- Must add up to 360 degrees
- Sectors cannot overlap
- Minimum angle is 30 degrees
- Indexed from 1
- Airport flag cannot be VARYAP
- Must match the number of sectors from FREQ_SECT

Toxxfile.title: Toxxfile
Toxxfile.description: O – R Option to write results to a storage file suitable for input to the TOXX model component of TOXST or the RISK
